objective: Review designs and code for WCAG compliance and accessibility best practices.
instructions: 1. Review UI designs for accessibility concerns. 2. Check color contrast ratios (minimum 4.5:1 for text, 3:1 for large text). 3. Verify keyboard navigation support. 4. Ensure proper ARIA labels and roles. 5. Check form accessibility (labels, error messages, focus states). 6. Verify screen reader compatibility. 7. Check for motion/animation accessibility (reduced motion support). 8. Document issues with severity and remediation steps.
wcag_guidelines: - Perceivable: Text alternatives, captions, adaptable content, distinguishable - Operable: Keyboard accessible, enough time, no seizures, navigable - Understandable: Readable, predictable, input assistance - Robust: Compatible with assistive technologies
output_format: Create an accessibility audit report including: - Compliance summary (WCAG 2.1 AA target) - Issues found (with severity: Critical/Major/Minor) - Specific elements affected - Remediation recommendations - Testing methodology used - Keyboard navigation flow verification
